description: A square temple in a temenos besides the London-Lewes road. Lewis (1966) suggests a construction date around 100 and an end of use in the early 3rd CE.
bibliography: Martyn, Blick, Brindle, et al, (2015), Church Field, Titsey (Surrey), available at: https://doi.org/10.5284/1030449
Rudling, D., Bird, D., (2008), Roman-Period temples and Religion in Roman Surrey, in Ritual Landscapes of Roman South-East Britain
Rivet, A., (1958), in Town and Country in Roman Britain, pg. 145
Graham, J., (1936), A Romano-Celtic Temple at Titsey, and the Roman Road, Surrey Archaeological Collections, 44, pg. 84 ff, available at: http://dx.doi.org/10.5284/1000221
(1936), Roman Britain in 1935, Journal of Roman Studies, 26, pg. 262
(1881), Thursday, December 11th, 1879., Proceedings of the Society of Antiquaries of London, 8, pg. 213 ff
